reblog.comment:
-Ellen Ullman, Close to the Machine

This is the paragraph of the book that made me finally realize it was okay and actually good to be in a constant state of terror as a software developer.

(via jennschiffer)

It gets worse when you switch to the management track, and worse still if you start a company.

source:
-Ellen Ullman, Close to the Machine

This is the paragraph of the book that made me finally realize it was okay and actually good to be in a constant state of terror as a software developer.

(via jennschiffer)

It gets worse when you switch to the management track, and worse still if you start a company.
summary: The corollary of constant change is ignorance. This is not often talked about: we computer experts barely know what we’re doing....
text: The corollary of constant change is ignorance. This is not often talked about: we computer experts barely know what we’re doing. We’re good at fussing and figuring out. We function well in a sea of unknowns. Our experience has only prepared us to deal with confusion. A programmer who denies this is probably lying, or else is densely unaware of himself
